item.title: Microsoft Authenticator on iOS moves backups fully to iCloud
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out a new backup system in September for its Authenticator app on iOS, removing the requirement to use a Microsoft personal account to back up TOTP secrets and account names. [...]

item.title: Microsoft confirms Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) sync is broken
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed a widespread issue in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) that prevents organizations from syncing with Microsoft Update and deploying the latest Windows updates. [...]

item.title: Qantas confirms data breach impacts 5.7 million customers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Australian airline Qantas has confirmed that 5.7 million people have been impacted by a recent data breach, in which threat actors stole customers' data. [...]

item.title: Google reveals details on Android’s Advanced Protection for Chrome
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google is sharing more information on how Chrome operates when Android mobile users enable Advanced Protection, highlighting strong security improvements. [...]

item.title: Bitcoin Depot breach exposes data of nearly 27,000 crypto users
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Bitcoin Depot, an operator of Bitcoin ATMs, is notifying customers of a data breach incident that has exposed their sensitive information. [...]

item.title: Ruckus Networks leaves severe flaws unpatched in management devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Multiple vulnerabilities that remain unpatched in Ruckus Wireless management products could be exploited to fully compromise the network environment they serve. [...]

item.title: Ingram Micro starts restoring systems after ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Ingram Micro has begun restoring systems and business services after suffering a massive SafePay ransomware attack right before the July 4th holiday. [...]

item.title: Treasury sanctions North Korean over IT worker malware scheme
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury sanctioned cyber actor Song Kum Hyok for his association with North Korea's hacking group Andariel and for facilitating IT worker schemes that generated revenue for the Pyongyang regime. [...]

item.title: The MFA You Trust Is Lying to You – and Here's How Attackers Exploit It
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Token
item.description: MFA Authenticator apps aren't cutting it anymore. Attackers are bypassing legacy MFA with fake sites and real-time phishing. Token Ring and BioStick stop them cold—with fingerprint-bound hardware. Learn more from Token. [...]

item.title: New ServiceNow flaw lets attackers enumerate restricted data
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A new vulnerability in ServiceNow, dubbed Count(er) Strike, allows low-privileged users to extract sensitive data from tables to which they should not have access. [...]

item.title: Samsung announces major security enhancements coming to One UI 8
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Samsung has announced multiple data security and privacy enhancements for its upcoming Galaxy smartphones running One UI 8, its custom user interface on top of Android. [...]

item.title: M&S confirms social engineering led to massive ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: M&S confirmed today that the retail outlet's network was initially breached in a "sophisticated impersonation attack" that ultimately led to a DragonForce ransomware attack. [...]

item.title: New Android TapTrap attack fools users with invisible UI trick
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A novel tapjacking technique can exploit user interface animations to bypass Android's permission system and allow access to sensitive data or trick users into performing destructive actions, such as wiping the device. [...]
